intro: Tarasa nototrichoides, commonly known as the white-veined tarasa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, with a distinctive white venation pattern that sets it apart from other species in the genus. The flowers, which bloom in clusters, are usually pale yellow to white, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
